=== Game Rules ===
This is vgdl rule file:
BasicGame
  SpriteSet
    floor > Immovable randomtiling=0.9 img=oryx/floor3 hidden=True
    goal  > Door color=GREEN img=oryx/doorclosed1
    key   > Immovable color=ORANGE img=oryx/key2
    sword > OrientedFlicker limit=5 singleton=True img=oryx/slash1
    movable >
      avatar  > ShootAvatar   stype=sword frameRate=8
        nokey   > img=oryx/swordman1
        withkey > color=ORANGE img=oryx/swordmankey1
      enemy >  
        monsterQuick > RandomNPC cooldown=2 cons=6 img=oryx/bat1
        monsterNormal > RandomNPC cooldown=4 cons=8 img=oryx/spider2
        monsterSlow > RandomNPC cooldown=8 cons=12 img=oryx/scorpion1
      wall > Immovable autotiling=true img=oryx/wall3
      	

  LevelMapping
    g > floor goal
    + > floor key        
    A > floor nokey
    1 > floor monsterQuick
    2 > floor monsterNormal
    3 > floor monsterSlow
    w > wall
    . > floor
    

  InteractionSet
    movable wall  > stepBack
    nokey goal    > stepBack
    goal withkey  > killSprite scoreChange=1
    enemy sword > killSprite scoreChange=2
    enemy enemy > stepBack
    avatar enemy > killSprite scoreChange=-1
    nokey key     > transformTo stype=withkey scoreChange=1 killSecond=True

  TerminationSet
    SpriteCounter stype=goal   win=True
    SpriteCounter stype=avatar win=False
This is vgdl rule in natural language:
Here’s a plain‑language breakdown of what’s going on in the game:

1. Game Type and General Feel:
 • It’s a grid‑based puzzle/arcade maze game with elements of action and combat. You control an avatar in a level where you need to navigate corridors, pick up key items, and avoid (or sometimes defeat) enemies that roam around.

2. Core Mechanics:
 • Movement on a tiled map – floors, walls, and other obstacles. Some objects (like walls) simply block you.
 • Item collection and transformation – your avatar starts as a “nokey” type. When you touch a “key” sprite (which appears as an orange key), it transforms the avatar into the “withkey” version. This change is necessary so you can interact properly with the exit.
 • Combat – your avatar can shoot a “sword” (which flickers briefly) to kill enemies and earn extra points. There are also enemy characters (including different types of monsters with varying speeds) that move around randomly.
 • Puzzle elements – you must figure out the order of actions: collecting the key first, avoiding temptations to fight enemies head‑on with your body (since colliding with an enemy as avatar carries a score penalty and might be risky) versus using your sword as a safer way to clear threats.

3. Objective and Win/Loss Conditions:
 • Your main goal is to exit the level. The door (labeled “goal” with a green door image) won’t let you go through unless you’re carrying the key (your avatar must be in the “withkey” state). When you reach the door while withkey, the door “dies” (is removed) and the game recognizes it as a win.
 • Losing the game happens if your avatar is killed (for example, by colliding directly with an enemy without using your sword). That enemy/ avatar collision interaction carries a negative score and if the avatar is removed from the level, it means game over.

4. Basic Strategy:
 • First, explore the maze and locate the key. Don’t rush – you might need to watch out for enemies nearby.
 • Once you’ve picked up the key (transformation: nokey becomes withkey), your main objective becomes finding the exit door.
 • Along the way, use your sword attack to eliminate or deter roaming enemies if they get too close. Shooting the sword is a safer alternative than colliding directly with them since the collision (avatar enemy) interaction can result in your death.
 • Plan your route carefully so that you avoid unnecessary enemy encounters. It can be wise to clear out some threats from a distance with the sword while making your way to the goal.
 • Remember that timing matters – enemies have different movement speeds and cooldowns. Adjust your movements and actions accordingly, ensuring you aren’t trapped.
 • Score considerations: You gain points for successfully using the key (when you pick it up) and for killing enemies with your sword; however, if you collide with an enemy as your avatar, you lose points. So balancing risk and reward is important.

In summary, the game combines puzzle‑solving (finding and using items to unlock progress) with arcade‑style action (dodging and striking at enemies). Success comes from a cautious yet decisive approach: grab the key first, neutralize threats smartly with your sword when necessary, and head for the exit door to win the level.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== High Level Plan ===
